docs.snippet: It looks like they might bring this one in at under three hours, so I'll curb my complaining. And I'll close by noting that this seemed not only like a relatively brief Oscar ceremony, but a small one. Maybe this is a harbinger of things to come....
docs.lead_paragraph: It looks like they might bring this one in at under three hours, so I'll curb my complaining. And I'll close by noting that this seemed not only like a relatively brief Oscar ceremony, but a small one. Maybe this is a harbinger of things to come. Like it or not, the movies have lost their pop-cultural supremacy, and the fate of the Oscars may either be to go after a vanished mass appeal or to scale down, acknowledge the shrinking of the audience and turn into something like the Tonys. More of a coterie affair, appealing to the aficionados and the curious. It would be an honorable outcome.
docs.abstract: It looks like they might bring this one in at under three hours, so I'll curb my complaining. And I'll close by noting that this seemed not only like a relatively brief Oscar ceremony, but a small one. Maybe this is a harbinger of things to come.

docs.snippet: First big surprise of the night! I haven't seen "Departures," but I was sure, like everyone else, that it would be "Waltz With Bashir" or "The Class" -- two of the biggest sensations in Cannes last May -- taking the best foreign language film Osca...
docs.lead_paragraph: First big surprise of the night! I haven't seen "Departures," but I was sure, like everyone else, that it would be "Waltz With Bashir" or "The Class" -- two of the biggest sensations in Cannes last May -- taking the best foreign language film Oscar. This is a bit of a puzzler to me, but since this is one of those categories where a voter has to have seen every nominee, maybe "Departures" is a great picture. I have to say I'm a bit disappointed that neither the social curiosity or "The Class" nor the political seriousness of "Bashir" moved the Academy. And of course, like my pal the Bagger, I can't believe that "Gomorrah" didn't merit a nomination. Another one of many boats missed by the Academy this year.
docs.abstract: First big surprise of the night! I haven't seen "Departures," but I was sure, like everyone else, that it would be "Waltz With Bashir" or "The Class" -- two of the biggest sensations in Cannes last May -- taking the best foreign language film Oscar.

docs.snippet: Gourmet magazine has put together a clevercollection of Oscar-themed cocktails named after the nominees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gourmet magazine has put together a clever collection of Oscar-themed cocktails named after the nominees. Want a Brad Pitt? Make sure you have some organic lime, cucumber and vodka on hand. Or maybe a Richard Jenkins is more your speed. You'll need Woodford Reserve bourbon and some bitters for a drink that Gourmet claims, much like the actor, "isn't completely new but is nonetheless stunning."
docs.abstract: Gourmet magazine has put together a clevercollection of Oscar-themed cocktails named after the nominees.

docs.snippet: The Bagger, along with a bunch of other ninnies, has been very excited to see what Bill Condon and Laurence Mark are going to come up with to shake the Oscar show out of its torpor. And then he saw a leaked video and it left him feeling just the s...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger, along with a bunch of other ninnies, has been very excited to see what Bill Condon and Laurence Mark are going to come up with to shake the Oscar show out of its torpor. And then he saw a leaked video and it left him feeling just the smallest bit terrified.
docs.abstract: The Bagger, along with a bunch of other ninnies, has been very excited to see what Bill Condon and Laurence Mark are going to come up with to shake the Oscar show out of its torpor. And then he saw a leaked video and it left him feeling just the smallest bit terrified.
